structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS
C RESTRUCTURE OF LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN COUNTY CONTAINING CITY OF FIRST CLASS

law.catch_line: Continued existence of county's cooperative compacts prior to adoption of consolidated local government.
law.text: Any cooperative compact in existence in a county containing a city of the first class on July 14, 2000, shall remain in effect unless a consolidated local government is adopted as provided in KRS 67C.101 to 67C.137. The terms and agreements within a cooperative compact shall remain the same and in effect until the installation of the officers of the newly consolidated local government. If the voters in a county containing a city of the first class fail to approve a proposal for a consolidated local government then the cooperative compact shall remain in effect for the duration of the terms of the compact agreement.
law.history: Created 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 189, sec. 14, effective July 14, 2000.
